file_content.text: The heroes of the Empire!
The hero of the Empire!
Very impressive work. Not only has Directive Seven been stopped, but you've obliterated every trace of their movement.
There is no length I will not go to protect the Empire, Moff.
I live to serve.
I expected no less from the Emperor's Wrath.
It was certainly an amusing distraction from the business of the Dark Council.
I rather enjoyed myself.
I am honored to have had your assistance, my lord.
Just remember that when you're recommending me to your friends.
That's why I'm the best.
I certainly will.
The fate of the Empire was on the line--this was no time for half-measures.
I only did what was necessary.
Agreed. And thanks to your resolve, billions of lives have been saved.
The renegade droids put up quite a fight.
It wasn't easy.
Clearly not enough to stop you.
Yes, yes--enjoy your talk of destruction and victory. I'll just see myself out.
What do heroes of the Empire receive for their hard work?
Let's discuss my reward.
Only the finest rewards we can offer, I assure you.
I see no reason I should remain for these mercenary discussions--I'll see myself out.
Ah, yes--you. While the Empire certainly appreciates your contributions to the resolution of this situation, you still represent a potential threat.
A threat? What are you talking about? I have no intention of harming anyone.
Perhaps, perhaps not. You are effectively no different from the other droids of Directive Seven. To fully ensure an end to this threat, you must be deactivated.
This droid is the final piece of Directive Seven. We won't be safe until he's dealt with.
I agree--deactivate C5.
No! I gave you everything!
I am a free being!
Perfect. The matter is closed.
I thank you again for your assistance--it has been an honor.
This droid risked everything to save the citizens of the Empire. He deserves his freedom.
C5 has earned his freedom.
I cannot disagree strongly enough. This droid could repeat the entire fiasco! He must be destroyed at once!
I am the Emperor's Wrath. You will do as I command.
You're questioning me?
As a member of the Dark Council, I believe the choice is mine.
You're questioning me?
I--of course, my lord. I sincerely apologize. Droid--you're free to go.
This droid isn't going to harm anyone.
He's no threat.
We'll see. Go, droid--leave us. But don't think we will forget that you're out there.
How could I?
This droid is an independent being who performed a valuable service to the Empire.
We have no right to kill him.
Very well--let it be your responsibility, then. Go, droid.
You've seen what I'm capable of. Don't go against me.
Release him or else.
I... of course. The droid may go.
I owe you my thanks. It is good to know that some among your kind can understand.
Perhaps we will meet again. I might like that.
There are... other matters I should see to now. I thank you again for your assistance. Good day.
Your ship is waiting.
...Diversionary attacks will be the responsibility of squadrons two, three and five. Distract or disable the enemy's anti-aircraft no matter the cost.
The stakes of this operation could not be higher. I expect casualties, as should you. I do not expect failure.
See to your pre-flight preparations. Operations will commence very soon--be ready. Dismissed.
The Emperor's Wrath is yours to deploy.
I am ready.
Then I shall not put such an honor to waste.
I sense little fear in your pilots. Very impressive, given the circumstances.
Your men seem well prepared.
My lord. I would never send a Dark Council member to battle without my finest men to serve as escorts. Shall we begin?
Good to see a well-run operation for once.
Looks like an organized crew.
Thank you, hunter. Let's begin.
Outline the operation you have planned, Moff. I'm ready.
Bring me up to speed.
It sounds like you expect quite a bit of opposition.
Expecting trouble?
Underestimation is the most costly form of surrender. Now, let's not waste any time.
I didn't come here to listen to you bark at the peons.
Don't keep me waiting.
Of course not. Let's get straight to business.
Our objective is the destruction of Directive Seven, the faction of renegade droids attempting to rebel and destroy all biological life in the galaxy.
These droids are well armed and well fortified. But fortunately for us, they are not unified--one member of the organization has helpfully chosen to betray their plans to us.
Then we have a way to destroy them.
Excellent.
Yes, and we even know where to find them: a remote moon in the Unknown Regions called Zadd.
How much has this traitor told us so far?
What have we learned?
The traitor revealed the location of Directive Seven's headquarters as Zadd, a small moon in the Unknown Regions. Scouts confirmed the facility's location.
How can we trust that this traitor is sincere?
Sounds like a trap.
All of the information has checked out. He even revealed their base of operations: a small moon in the Unknown Regions called Zadd.
The traitor also revealed the movement's ultimate plan. They've developed a coded signal that converts any droid that receives it to Directive Seven's control.
Their facility has sufficient power to transmit that signal across the entire galaxy. If they aren't stopped, every single droid in operation will rise up against us simultaneously.
Their signal won't help them if we wipe them out before they can use it.
Then we strike before they do.
Precisely. In this, we cannot fail.
Turning every droid against us at once... I'm impressed.
Ingenious.
Our only option is to prevent that signal from ever being transmitted.
Is there a reason we aren't switching off every droid in sight?
So shut off the droids.
Even deactivated droids retain some level of activity--the signal would still be received. Our only option is to prevent the signal's transmission.
A preemptive strike sounds like our only option.
So we need to strike first.
Precisely. We must prevent the transmission of that signal at any cost.
There must be some way to jam the droids' transmissions.
Can't we block the signal?
Unfortunately, no. We're technically outmatched--our only option is direct action.
How could they develop a signal that would affect every type of droid?
That's very hard to believe.
They've already demonstrated its effectiveness against the droids of our fleet. This is not a question of "if," but "when." We must hit first.
Our plan of attack is simple: Under extensive starfighter cover, a shuttle will land you at the outskirts of Directive Seven's headquarters.
You will infiltrate the facility, locate the traitor and use his information to obliterate Directive Seven's operation.
When I'm finished, there won't be a single droid left in one piece.
I will crush them.
I have yet to meet the enemy I cannot destroy from within.
Simple enough.
You get me in there, I'll make sure there's not a droid left standing.
You got it.
I will eradicate every last trace of the droids' operation, sir.
Consider it done.
An ion bombardment from orbit seems like the simpler way.
Why not hit from above?
Couldn't you simply bombard their headquarters from space?
Why strike from the ground?
Their defenses are impenetrable to even our largest ship-mounted weaponry. Only a surface attack has any chance of success.
If you're wrong about this traitor, or the droids' defenses... you will regret it.
I hope you're right.
Our intelligence is as solid as it can be, I assure you. And we do not have time to second-guess ourselves.
Your pilot is ready to launch as soon as you are. The fate of our Empire falls to you--good luck.
I do not have time for idle discussion.
